overview: Rubiks’ Road is a bicycle path built in the 1980s and named after Alfreds Rubiks, leader of the Latvian Communist party at the time. One of the most ferocious opposers to Latvia’s independence in the early 1990s and later elected to the European Parliament.
tagline: A film about a world that walks, runs, crawls, sits, rides, flies. And falls. A living world.
title: On Rubik's Road
